lead_paragraph: As they did wherever and whenever they camped or paused on their long, peripatetic westward journey toward mass suicide in Southern California, members of the Heaven's Gate cult found work in Arizona as nerdy computer programmers, polite-to-a-fault office clerks and tireless dawn-to-dusk day laborers. But it turns out that they also busied themselves in other ways during a 10-month stay in 1995 and 1996 in a spacious house in this well-off Phoenix suburb.
abstract: Members of Heaven's Gate cult, who committed mass suicide in California, were working on screenplay about their lives and times; movie producer Alex Pappas, who worked on script with cult members, comments (M)

headline.main: Cult Had a Story It Wanted to Tell on the Big Screen
headline.kicker: DEATH IN A CULT: THE SCREENPLAY
